pr_title: Issue 4920: From noteTime api, throw exception rather than set the response code

timeline.body: Why can't you *spy* directly this *controllerService* variable?
timeline.bodyText: Why can't you spy directly this controllerService variable?
timeline.bodyHTML: Why can't you spy directly this controllerService variable?
timeline.author: eolivelli

replies.bodyText: controllerService which is an instance of ControllerServiceImpl is what we are verifying in this test.
replies.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText:
I am not sure this is the right way. But unfortunately I don't have much time to suggest another approach.
So I am fine with keeping it.
Maybe one day we could introduce PowerMock, that allows you to rewrite entire methods and constructors without introducing this intermediate objects.
Now we are introducing this layer between the streamStore and the ControllerService, I don't have enough context, so I don't know if it may introduce some sort of difference from the behavior of the tests  and the execution at runtime in production (the risk is to not test the right thing).
replies.author: eolivelli

timeline.body: Override should be fine here since io.pravega.controller.server.v1.ControllerServiceImplTest#tearDown method already has @After annotation right ? https://github.com/pravega/pravega/blob/b81cf9e69bb53b0e0860f703f3a47a371ad80cc6/controller/src/test/java/io/pravega/controller/server/v1/ControllerServiceImplTest.java#L86-L87

replies.bodyText: its not overridden because its not defined in the base class.
